comment.body: Most likely.
Welcome aboard! ;)

Welcome to Zeronet!
Sounds good, but the mesh network I have employed (hyperboria/cjdns) uses IPv6 addressing (fc00::/8) and [Zeronet does still not support IPv6](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/148).
@Th3B3st: sure, but it hasn't happened yet.
Can't you just unfollow the account?
@Martinv: You're right, I forgot about the Everyone stream.
Doesn't it appear automatically when you start seeding the site? I.e., right after yiou have visited (and downloaded) the site the very first time.
@Jjg: Nothing is needed here. Whenever I visit a new zite, it automagically get's added to ZeroHello.
@Jjg: Haha, good! :)
I got Rev1839 when pulling a couple of minutes ago.
Sunt eu un haiduc. ðŸ˜‰

It looks interesting. It's a pity they've chosen Python 2 only, though.

Have you tried it yourself?

Now that I take a closer look, I think I actually did install it and run it for a few days, a year or two ago, then forgot all about it:

https://onename.com/kseistrup
Is your device supported by LineageOS?
https://download.lineageos.org/
@Jjg: https://download.lineageos.org/m8
http://wiki.lineageos.org/m8_install.html
And I can recommend installing the TWRP recovery first: https://twrp.me/devices/htconem8gsm.html

Caveat: I've installed LineageOS on an old LG Nexus 5 (hammerhead) that ran CM 14 before. I became a little nervous because CM seemed to be an impasse, but the came LineageOS. It installed without any problems and runs like a charm. But of course I can't guarantee that you'll have the same experience on M8.
Perhaps you can use [this](/todayilearned.bit/?Post:17) as a starting point.
@Jjg: Yes, it's pretty cool â€” and it makes getting and using a certificate from Let's Encrypt a breeze.

Btw, you shouldn't take the â€œno QUICâ€ from my short writeup seriously. Caddy has been updated several times since then and QUIC seems to work these days. Also, you most likely needn't disable HTTP/2.
@Jjg: I haven't tried that, but perhaps you could add the zite address to the `http://127.0.0.1:43110` part in `Caddyfile` (provided you're gonna use Caddy)?
@Jjg: I don't know. But you should probably run Zeronet with a multiuser setup. That way each visitor is offered a unique identity.
@Jjg: Take a look in `â€¦/zeronet/plugins/`.
LOL!
If you can read this comment I don't have the problem (Rev1851).
@Firebox: FeedHub. Being able to feed RSS/Atom feeds directly into ZeroNet would also be nice.
It easy to host a static (albeit updateable) website on ZeroNet, if that's what you mean.
@crypdick: You can either run â€œpython2 src/main.py siteSign â€¦â€ or you can open the site in the webui and do a â€œsign & publishâ€ as per usual.

I think this is a case of â€œcitation neededâ€.

There are more than 7E9 people on the Earth. Wikipedia says [7.4 billion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_population). That's more than 318 billion copies of Shrek 3 on DVD annually. It doesn't sound credible to me.
It doesn't.
@Styromaniac: Ah yes, I misread your question.

Cool! Although it's difficult not to smile at the

All files downloaded from peers are verified with SHA-1 as required by the BitTorrent specification.

:)
The ZeroMail on my instance hasn't been working for weeks (perhaps even months).

```py
>>> from datetime import datetime
>>>
>>> now = datetime.now()
>>> secs = now.timestamp()
>>> msecs = secs * 1000
```
What does time.windows.com do?
Urgh!
@Mikunyan: Oh, ok. It doesn't quite sound like a service that ZeroNet should be responsible for.
https://namecha.in/name/d/abcy

Or, from a shell (if you're running your own `namecoind`):

`$ namecoin-cli name_show d/abcy`

Sometimes the jokes don't begin until the understanding has been there for a while: When you learn a new language, you don't start making jokes in that language until you have a somewhat solid grasp of the language.

Except for being written in nodejs and being an immense resource hog (CPU-, RAM-, _and_ disk-wise), Scuttlebutt is a very good social network and communications platform. It's truly decentralised (as in _mesh_), with no servers or trackers. At. All.
